intro: Sida gracilipes, commonly known as slender sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with slender, erect stems and small, woolly leaves. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, with five petals and stamens that are often longer than the petals. Sida gracilipes is adapted to sandy or coastal soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
